sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Methamphetamine Precursor Tracking Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Methamphetamine Precursor Tracking Act.

sections.heading: Purposes.
sections.text: The purposes of this Act are to establish a program to track purchases of targeted methamphetamine precursors at covered pharmacies in Illinois; to track purchases of targeted methamphetamine precursors for the likely purpose of manufacturing methamphetamine; to starve methamphetamine manufacturers of the methamphetamine precursors they need to make methamphetamine; to locate and shut down methamphetamine laboratories; and ultimately to reduce the harm that methamphetamine manufacturing and manufacturers are inflicting on individuals, families, communities, first responders, the economy, and the environment in Illinois and beyond.

sections.heading: Immunity from civil liability.    In the event that any agent or employee of a covered pharmacy or retail distributor reports to any law enforcement officer or agency any suspicious activity concerning a targeted methamphetamine precursor or other methamphetamine ingredient or ingredients, the agent
sections.text: Immunity from civil liability. In the event that any agent or employee of a covered pharmacy or retail distributor reports to any law enforcement officer or agency any suspicious activity concerning a targeted methamphetamine precursor or other methamphetamine ingredient or ingredients, the agent or employee and the pharmacy or retail distributor itself are immune from civil liability based on allegations of defamation, libel, slander, false arrest, or malicious prosecution, or similar allegations, except in cases of willful or wanton misconduct. A covered pharmacy that uses the electronic sales tracking system in accordance with this Act is immune from civil liability for any act or omission committed in carrying out the duties required by this Section, unless the act or omission was due to deliberate or willful and wanton misconduct. A covered pharmacy is not liable for damages resulting from a data breach that was proximately caused by a failure on the part of the electronic sales tracking system.

sections.heading: Preemption. The regulation of the tracking of methamphetamine precursors is an exclusive power and function of the State
sections.text: A county or municipality, including a home rule unit, may not regulate the tracking of methamphetamine precursors. This Section is a denial and limitation of home rule powers und
